ref: 3495 kōṭáyatē ʻ breaks ʼ Dhātup. [Cf. prakuṭya ʻ having cut into small pieces ʼ MBh., Pa. ākōṭēti ʻ breaks, beats down, stamps ʼ. -- √kuṭ2]
K. kūrun ʻ to gouge out, extract (an eye, kernel of walnut, etc.) ʼ;
N. kornu ʻ to tear, scratch, comb ʼ;
B. koṛā ʻ to dig, bore through, pierce ʼ;
Bi. koṛab ʻ to dig, cut through (e.g. a field embankment to let out flood water) ʼ;
H. koṛnā, kornā ʻ to dig up, scrape out, carve ʼ;
Si. koḷanavā ʻ to press, flatten, smooth ʼ Geiger BSOS viii 556, koḷavanavā ʻ to beat down, stamp ʼ. -- Deriv.
A. korokiba ʻ to scoop out ʼ. -- Forms with -- r -- alternatively < *kōrati.
